paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a novel pathogenic variant in the KCNH2 gene, including penetrance data and functional studies.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Cardiac arrhythmia due to long QT syndrome
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Collectively, the results from comprehensive forensic studies, medical records review and molecular testing support that the cause of death of the 18-year-old decedent was cardiac arrhythmia due to long QT syndrome caused by the pathogenic variant in the KCNH2 gene.

functional_data.summary: Functional studies showed that the hERG-ΔQ1068 variant has a mixed phenotype with both gain and loss of function characteristics, predominantly exhibiting loss of function.

variants.segregation_data: The variant in KCNH2 arose de novo, as neither parents nor siblings carried the variant.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on functional studies and segregation analysis.
variants.additional_notes: The variant was identified in a single case with no other family members affected.
key_quotes: Targeted testing for the two variants found in the decedent showed that neither parents nor the four siblings in the family harbored the pathogenic variant p.Gln1068Ter in KCNH2; therefore, the variant most likely arose de novo.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
